watched every single day for the entire semester and she would bring this big
big plastic bag full of a plastic clamshell full of food and a plastic fork and knife and a plastic water

would be like oh my God you're the worst person in the world right because we were these Environmental Studies majors and this
girl was making so much trash and was really not even seemingly thinking about it she would just eat and throw it away
even though NYU had a comprehensive recycling program still just making all of this plastic trash and it really
annoyed me and so one day after class I went home to make dinner and the same

that yeah and I was really mad at myself and I was really sad and I couldn't
believe that I hadn't noticed that before right because I was getting so mad at this girl for making so much

so so baa is awesome she's this woman that lives in M Valley in California and

when I entered it and to me living zero waste has been the best way to align

clothing so everything that I wear and everything that I own is secondhand um I
don't purchase any new clothing anymore because there's enough clothing already in the waist stream and so I feel the need to reuse what's already out there
and then adequately dispose of it by doing things like textile recycling or mending things that are just a little
bit ripped or a little bit broken instead of throwing them away um I learned how to do things like make my own products so I finally learned how to
make the toothpaste and the deodorant and the shampoo um and by doing those little things over time it turns out
that I was able to reduce all of the trash that I was producing and who still thinks this is
hard so when you hear zero waste it seems really daunting and really impossible because
it's a big umbrella term it's like hearing the word climate change no one really understands what that means
because it's a huge term and it's not broken down for us but when you actually look at Living zero waste and you break
it down into its pieces it's just a lot of little onetime or baby changes that have a long-term positive impact when I
started doing this I did it for myself and not for anyone else I did it because I wanted to live in alignment with my
values but I'm lazy like super lazy and I wouldn't have continued doing this if
it was hard or impossible or frustrating it just like doesn't match with my
personality and so I realized that actually living this lifestyle improved my life and that's why I continued doing
it so the first benefit of living this lifestyle is that I actually save a lot of money um just talking about
secondhand clothing I save so much money by doing just that I mean even that
change alone has saved me I'm sure thousands of dollars over the course of the past 3 years if you think about something as simple as a pair of jeans
you can go to a department store and buy a pair of jeans for like $200 which to me is like sickening and horrible and I
hate that and shouldn't be the case or I could go to Goodwill and get a totally good pair of jeans for a dollar $5 $10
so even with that that's like one of the first ways that I saved money I also saved money by learning how to plan
ahead so before I started Living this lifestyle I was in college and I didn't
really plan because it's college students were kind of like always just doing the next thing and like scratching
to get all these things done and that's it um but when I actually slowed down and I started thinking about the things
that I was purchasing especially when it came to food because you know when I was in college I would go into my fridge and realize like oh my God it's 2: in the
morning and I have nothing and so I'd have to go to the corner store and buy crap packaged in plastic and eat ice
cream for dinner because that was the only option I had and so when I slowed down and started Living zero waste which
also meant living you know package free I learned how to make a shopping list and when you have a shopping list you go
in with a plan and so I wasn't just impulse buying when I went to the store I wasn't looking at cookies and being like hey you cookies you're coming home
with me it wasn't like that at all it was like I want salads for dinner every night and I'm doing this this week and
so just by banking those purchase purchasing decisions I was able to save money because I wasn't spending money on
things that I didn't need um also saved a lot of money by making my own products
so toothpaste for instance I think is a really good example because if you want to use natural toothpaste a thing of
TOMS I think is like $7 can anyone confirm that
$767 yeah for me to make my own toothpaste it's about 20 to 30 cents for the same amount of product and there's

all of the ingredients that I need to make these things in my house so something like that saves me a ton of
money the second thing is I eat better so again I mentioned going to the store and going in with a plan and because of
that I wasn't making or I'm not making impulse decisions so I can't buy
processed package junk anymore because I choose to shop package free and lucky
for me and for my body that stuff doesn't come package free really and if I do want to eat something that's sweet
I'll either make it myself or I'll go to a place like a bakery that's not using preservatives or synthetic ingredients
or believe it or not some foods actually have petrochemicals in them so nothing
artificial so that's resulted in me feeling and being a lot healthier so things like my weight have stabilized I
don't feel heavy and Bloated after eating anymore which is something that used to happen all of the time when I was just eating impulsively and eating
sugary things um so eating a lot better saving money those things have resulted
in me just feeling a lot better by feeling better I've become so much
happier and become liberated in the sense that for the first time I really am living the things that I want to see

you know reversing the decisions that businesses have made I'm saying no to plastic because I don't like what the

my values so I'm sure you guys are still like this is crap this is hard I'm not

relate to that um and so to eliminate that I learned how to compost and just
by learning to compost I removed about this much trash from my life each week
because that's about how much compost I throw away every single week or compost each week um the second thing that I saw
that I had was product packaging so to remove that problem from my trash I
learned how to make my own products and then the third thing was food packaging and so to eliminate that I learned how

sources of trash I eliminated basically 90% of my garbage just three things
three simple things the second thing that I like to suggest is picking at the lwh hanging
fruit so these are the little one-time simple changes that you can make it in your everyday life that will have a

impact the third thing that I like to suggest is the actual DIY so what I talked about making your own

essentially save money and have really clean feeling teeth I've brushed with baking soda for years now went to the

works and then that kind of got me on the rooll of making all of my own products um so now I have a four item
Beauty routine that I do every day it's just toothpaste deodorant body and face lotion and
what's the other one soap yeah for everything and that's it and I make everything
myself so just by doing those three things I was able to totally eliminate
all the trash that I make and when I started doing this again I was in college

was a good job I would be totally happy with it if something didn't happen I realized that I was getting a ton of
emails from people um about all different sorts of things but one that came really frequently was like Hey I

products um I found out some pretty insane things about cleaning products
one of which is that there are over 85,000 industrial chemicals that are used uh and most of them actually
majority of them aren't tested for safety before being released out into the market for use and how they are
tested is when someone gets sick from them and then a bunch of people get sick from them and then they're finally
looked at and or probably not taken off of the market that to me was really really scary and the second thing so
like the cherry on top of it was that cleaning product Manu facturers aren't even legally required to tell you what
they put inside of the products on the product packaging and so we can go to the store and buy you know X Y and Z
clean product brand and look at the ingredients and be totally happy with them but then go home and use it and not
even know what we're putting in our homes because it's not legally required to be completely transparent about it
and so when I learned that I was like that's not okay at all for any reason
because I believe that we as consumers have a right to know what we're buying what we're putting in our homes and and
having a right to have products that are safe for our homes and our bodies and
the environment and so I took that moment to kind of assess my life and what I was doing and I realized that I
had been making these clean products for years and that they were super effective and really inexpensive and I realized
that I had an opportunity to actually start a company to make make products for people that
don't feel like they have time to make them themselves but that are as safe as ones that they could make themselves
hopefully inspiring them to stop buying my products and to actually make them themselves so I launched a company
called the simply Co which I started on a Kickstarter um and my first product
that I have is a laundry detergent that's three ingredients it's baking soda washing soda and organic vegan soap
and through that I hope to grow and expand the business to show that you don't need tox chemicals to clean you
don't have to accept the way that things are in society so like one of the biggest things that I did was ask you
know like why are there so many toxic chemicals and everything and when did this start becoming okay when did people
decide that it was okay to poison people when did businesses get the green light
to start doing that and so through this company I hope to educate people on
making more informed choices and hopefully be the bridge from buying products to making them yourself because
it's a lot cheaper than buying them so through this whole thing I
